questions.promptMd: Which statement is MOST core and decision‑useful?

answers.contentMd: Cut incident MTTR by 30% this quarter
Improve reliability and collaboration across the org
We propose a thoughtful approach to excellence
We should consider possibilities and explore options

questions.promptMd: True or False: Short sentences almost always outperform long ones for core messages.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Short sentences reduce parsing load and ambiguity.
Length seldom adds clarity to the core.

questions.promptMd: Which edit most effectively removes a second competing idea?

answers.contentMd: Split into two sentences: one on MTTR, one on morale
Add more adjectives to make it inspiring
Add a subordinate clause with background
Use a semicolon to connect both ideas
answers.feedbackMd: Still two ideas in one sentence.

questions.promptMd: True or False: A core message should be memorable even without the supporting data immediately visible.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Data supports recall, but the core should stand alone.
If it’s forgettable, it’s not the core.
